meanings.definition: Complimentary or flattering to an excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: The teacher gave a fulsome praise to the student for her hard work.
meanings.sent2: Her fulsome compliments made him feel appreciated.
meanings.sent3: The fulsome compliments from the salesperson made the customer smile.
meanings.sent4: The fulsome adoration of the fans overwhelmed the celebrity.
meanings.sent5: The fulsome bouquet of flowers brightened her day.

meanings.sent1: His fulsome flattery made her uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The politician's fulsome promises were met with skepticism.
meanings.sent3: The fulsome apologies seemed insincere to the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her fulsome excuses fell on deaf ears.
meanings.sent5: The fulsome display of wealth was off-putting.

meanings.definition: Disgusting or offensive, especially due to excessiveness.
meanings.sent1: The fulsome smell coming from the garbage can made her gag.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant received complaints about the fulsome taste of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The fulsome mess left in the room was unbearable.
meanings.sent4: The fulsome sight of the decaying fruit was repulsive.
meanings.sent5: The fulsome sound of the alarm was deafening.
